faq.question: What is the aim of this project?
faq.answer: I did this project to improve my web development skills. It was inspired by the 42evaluators.com website.

faq.question: What technologies were used in this project?
faq.answer: This project was built using Java Spring Boot and React.

faq.question: Is the project open source?
faq.answer: Yes, the project is open source. You can find the GitHub repository at https://github.com/fluchtens/42Stats

faq.question: How can I contribute to this project?
faq.answer: You can contribute to this project by creating a pull request on the GitHub repository.

faq.question: How often is the data updated?
faq.answer: The data is updated once a day in our database.

faq.question: Why save data?
faq.answer: The api of 42 has a rate limit, we are limited to a maximum number of requests per minute. So we can't afford to retrieve data directly from the API for every user request.

faq.question: Where is the data stored?
faq.answer: The website and database are hosted by OVH in Gravelines, France.
